title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement IMBEI team. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Introduction to IMBEIstyle
text: goal IMBEIstyle provide simple way create analysis report, styled fancy options UM corporate design colors, revealjs quarto presentation, similar fashion. content cover need e.g. poster template - especially doable within quarto framework.

title: Introduction to IMBEIstyle
text: can create reports presentations package.

title: Introduction to IMBEIstyle
text: source document opened (e.g. within RStudio IDE), can compile see everything works expected. next obvious steps oriented towards filling contents. , can refer creation Quarto based document - Quarto tutorial (https://quarto.org/docs/get-started/hello/rstudio.html) excellent place start. rendered, report document look like:
code: IMBEIstyle::create_bioinfo_html(file_name = "myfirstreport",                                 report_folder = tempdir()) #> ℹ Using report folder, /var/folders/l7/zzmm12b945z_f71ljwfqj7z00000gn/T//Rtmp742miX #> ℹ Created '_extensions' folder into /var/folders/l7/zzmm12b945z_f71ljwfqj7z00000gn/T//Rtmp742miX #> ℹ bioinfo-html was installed to _extensions folder in the specified report directory. #> ℹ Copied auxiliary files into the toplevel report folder. #> You might want to edit the corresponding lines in the yaml section #> ☐ Edit #>   /var/folders/l7/zzmm12b945z_f71ljwfqj7z00000gn/T/Rtmp742miX/myfirstreport.qmd. #> ✔ Have fun with your report - available inside the folder /var/folders/l7/zzmm12b945z_f71ljwfqj7z00000gn/T//Rtmp742miX

title: Introduction to IMBEIstyle
text: Similarly, create Quarto-based presentation, can use … look like (static snapshot):
code: IMBEIstyle::create_bioinfo_revealjs(file_name = "myfirstpresentation",                                     presentation_folder = tempdir()) #> ℹ Using presentation folder, /var/folders/l7/zzmm12b945z_f71ljwfqj7z00000gn/T//Rtmp742miX #> ℹ bioinfo-revealjs was installed to _extensions folder in the specified report directory. #> ℹ Copied auxiliary files into the toplevel presentation folder. #> You might want to edit the corresponding lines in the yaml section #> ☐ Edit #>   /var/folders/l7/zzmm12b945z_f71ljwfqj7z00000gn/T/Rtmp742miX/myfirstpresentation.qmd. #> ✔ Have fun with your presentation - available inside the folder /var/folders/l7/zzmm12b945z_f71ljwfqj7z00000gn/T//Rtmp742miX

what: Functions to write reports and create presentations, in the IMBEI style
title: Functions to write reports and create presentations, in the IMBEI style
text: goal IMBEIstyle provide simple way create analysis report, styled fancy options UM corporate design colors, revealjs quarto presentation, similar fashion. content cover need e.g. poster template - especially doable within quarto framework.

title: Functions to write reports and create presentations, in the IMBEI style
text: can install development version IMBEIstyle like :

title: Functions to write reports and create presentations, in the IMBEI style
text: can create reports presentations package
code: library("IMBEIstyle")  IMBEIstyle::create_bioinfo_html(file_name = "myfirstreport",                                 report_folder = tempdir()) #> ℹ Using report folder, /var/folders/l7/zzmm12b945z_f71ljwfqj7z00000gn/T//RtmpPQ1HvM #> ℹ Created '_extensions' folder into /var/folders/l7/zzmm12b945z_f71ljwfqj7z00000gn/T//RtmpPQ1HvM #> ℹ bioinfo-html was installed to _extensions folder in the specified report directory. #> ℹ Copied auxiliary files into the toplevel report folder. #> You might want to edit the corresponding lines in the yaml section #> ☐ Edit #>   '/var/folders/l7/zzmm12b945z_f71ljwfqj7z00000gn/T/RtmpPQ1HvM/myfirstreport.qmd'. #> ✔ Have fun with your report - available inside the folder /var/folders/l7/zzmm12b945z_f71ljwfqj7z00000gn/T//RtmpPQ1HvM  IMBEIstyle::create_bioinfo_revealjs("myveryfirstpresentation",                                     presentation_folder = tempdir()) #> ℹ Using presentation folder, /var/folders/l7/zzmm12b945z_f71ljwfqj7z00000gn/T//RtmpPQ1HvM #> ℹ bioinfo-revealjs was installed to _extensions folder in the specified report directory. #> ℹ Copied auxiliary files into the toplevel presentation folder. #> You might want to edit the corresponding lines in the yaml section #> ☐ Edit #>   '/var/folders/l7/zzmm12b945z_f71ljwfqj7z00000gn/T/RtmpPQ1HvM/myveryfirstpresentation.qmd'. #> ✔ Have fun with your presentation - available inside the folder /var/folders/l7/zzmm12b945z_f71ljwfqj7z00000gn/T//RtmpPQ1HvM

what: Create a Quarto html report, Bioinfo-group styled — create_bioinfo_html
title: Create a Quarto html report, Bioinfo-group styled — create_bioinfo_html
text: Create Quarto html report, Bioinfo-group styled

title: Create a Quarto html report, Bioinfo-group styled — create_bioinfo_html
code: create_bioinfo_html(   file_name = NULL,   report_folder = NULL,   ext_name = "bioinfo-html",   expose_aux_files = TRUE )

title: Create a Quarto html report, Bioinfo-group styled — create_bioinfo_html
text: file_name Character string, name file report - need specify qmd extension. report_folder Character string, pointing folder report associated files created. Defaults NULL, falls back current working directory. sensible value variable "vignettes", used context package development ext_name Character string, defaulting "bioinfo-html". values (possibly functions) "bioinfo-revealjs" similar... expose_aux_files Logical value, whether expose&copy auxiliary files (scss bib) toplevel specified folder.

title: Create a Quarto html report, Bioinfo-group styled — create_bioinfo_html
text: Invisibly, path created quarto source file report

title: Create a Quarto html report, Bioinfo-group styled — create_bioinfo_html
code: temp_folder <- tempdir() create_bioinfo_html(file_name = "myreport",                     report_folder = temp_folder) #> ℹ Using report folder, /var/folders/l7/zzmm12b945z_f71ljwfqj7z00000gn/T//RtmpxTdGib #> ℹ Created '_extensions' folder into /var/folders/l7/zzmm12b945z_f71ljwfqj7z00000gn/T//RtmpxTdGib #> ℹ bioinfo-html was installed to _extensions folder in the specified report directory. #> ℹ Copied auxiliary files into the toplevel report folder. #> You might want to edit the corresponding lines in the yaml section #> ☐ Edit #>   /var/folders/l7/zzmm12b945z_f71ljwfqj7z00000gn/T/RtmpxTdGib/myreport.qmd. #> ✔ Have fun with your report - available inside the folder /var/folders/l7/zzmm12b945z_f71ljwfqj7z00000gn/T//RtmpxTdGib

what: Create a Quarto presentation, Bioinfo-group styled — create_bioinfo_revealjs
title: Create a Quarto presentation, Bioinfo-group styled — create_bioinfo_revealjs
text: Create Quarto presentation, Bioinfo-group styled

title: Create a Quarto presentation, Bioinfo-group styled — create_bioinfo_revealjs
code: create_bioinfo_revealjs(   file_name = NULL,   presentation_folder = NULL,   ext_name = "bioinfo-revealjs",   expose_aux_files = TRUE )

title: Create a Quarto presentation, Bioinfo-group styled — create_bioinfo_revealjs
text: file_name Character string, name file report - need specify qmd extension. preparing presentation end getting published online, might clever rename rendered file index.html (start already index.qmd file, end good practice keep informative file names) presentation_folder Character string, pointing folder presentation associated files created. Defaults NULL, falls back current working directory. ext_name Character string, defaulting "bioinfo-revealjs". values (possibly functions) "bioinfo-html" similar... expose_aux_files Logical value, whether expose&copy auxiliary files (scss, possibly .bib file well) toplevel specified folder.

title: Create a Quarto presentation, Bioinfo-group styled — create_bioinfo_revealjs
text: Invisibly, path created quarto source file presentation

title: Create a Quarto presentation, Bioinfo-group styled — create_bioinfo_revealjs
code: temp_folder <- tempdir() create_bioinfo_revealjs(file_name = "mypresentation",                         presentation_folder = temp_folder) #> ℹ Using presentation folder, /var/folders/l7/zzmm12b945z_f71ljwfqj7z00000gn/T//RtmpxTdGib #> ℹ bioinfo-revealjs was installed to _extensions folder in the specified report directory. #> ℹ Copied auxiliary files into the toplevel presentation folder. #> You might want to edit the corresponding lines in the yaml section #> ☐ Edit #>   /var/folders/l7/zzmm12b945z_f71ljwfqj7z00000gn/T/RtmpxTdGib/mypresentation.qmd. #> ✔ Have fun with your presentation - available inside the folder /var/folders/l7/zzmm12b945z_f71ljwfqj7z00000gn/T//RtmpxTdGib

title: IMBEIstyle v0.1
text: Initial version package, containing template “classical” analysis report used Bioinformatics group
